mfm.fluorescence.simulation.dye_diffusion.simulate_decays(dyes, decay_parameter, simulation_parameter, quenching_parameter, save_decays=True, directory='./', file_id='', get_qy=False)[source]¶

Function for batch procession of decays (use-case see notebooks: quenching_and_fret.ipynb)

Parameters

  • dyes – a dictionary of dyes

  • decay_parameter – a instance of the DecaySimulationParameter class

  • simulation_parameter – a instance of the DiffusionSimulationParameter class

  • quenching_parameter – a instance of the ProteinQuenching class

  • save_decays – bool

  • directory – string pointing to directory in which the simulation results are saved

Returns

dictionary containing the simulated decays

mfm.fluorescence.simulation.photon module¶

mfm.fluorescence.simulation.photon.simulate_decay_quench(n_curves, decay, dt_tac, k_quench, t_step, tau0, **kwargs)[source]¶
Parameters

  • n_curves – int Number of samples taken from the trajectory

  • decay – numpy-array An array later containing the fluorescence intensity

  • dt_tac – float The time-resolution of the decay

  • k_quench – array (float32) Array of quenching rates (FRET-rates+kQ) for each frame

  • t_step – float Time resolution of the diffusion simulation

  • tau0 – float Lifetime of the dye in absence of quenching

mfm.fluorescence.simulation.photon.simulate_photon_trace_rate(n_ph, quench, t_step=0.01, tau0=4.1, n_traj=4, **kwargs)[source]¶

This function generates a stream of photons considering quenching of the excited state using a mix of a purely Poissonian process and the know solution of a Poissonian process (a exponential decay).

In a first step a random number in the interval between [0, 1) is generated. Using this random number the position on the exponential decay is looked-up. This position corresponds to the waiting time of the emission of a photon.

Given the time between the excitation and the photon emission the quenching trajectory is used to determine whether this photon could have been emitted. Starting from the time of excitation to the time of emission of the photon for each quenching event is modelled as Poissonian process. If the excited state is quenched no photon is emitted.

Parameters

  • n_ph – int The total number of photons to be simulated

  • quench – numpy-array (float32) The quenching array containing the instantaneous rate of quenching for each frame of the dye-trajectory

  • t_step – float The time-step of the simulation

  • tau0 – float The lifetime of the dye in absence of quenching

  • n_traj – int The number of photon trajectories to be simulated

  • ravel_traj – bool If True the trajectories are merged/stacked into one big trajectory

  • kwargs –

Returns

a tuple of two numpy-arrays The first element contains the waiting times of the unquenched dye The second element contains an array if actually a photon was emitted of the type np.unit8
